text: Coatbridge was a parliamentary constituency represented in the House of Commons of the Parliament of the United Kingdom. It returned one Member of Parliament (MP) from 1918 to 1950, elected by the first past the post voting system. It was formed by the division of Lanarkshire. The name was changed in 1950 to Coatbridge and Airdrie. A later constituency, Coatbridge and Chryston, existed between 1997 and 2005, until it was redrawn as Coatbridge, Chryston and Bellshill. == Boundaries == The Representation of the People Act 1918 provided that the constituency was to consist of "the burghs of Coatbridge and Airdrie".Representation of the People Act 1918, Schedule 9. == Members of Parliament == {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- | style="background-color: " | | 1918 | Arthur Louis Hamilton Buchanan | Coalition Conservative |- | style="background-color: " | | 1922 | James C. Welsh | Labour |- | style="background-color: " | | 1931 | William Templeton | Conservative |- | style="background-color: " | | 1935 | James Barr | Labour |- | style="background-color: " | | 1945 | Jean Mann | Labour |- |colspan="2" align="center"|1950 |colspan="2"| constituency abolished: see Coatbridge & Airdrie |} == Election results == == References == Category:Historic parliamentary constituencies in Scotland (Westminster) Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies established in 1918 Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies disestablished in 1950 Category:Coatbridge Category:Politics of North Lanarkshire
title: Coatbridge (UK Parliament constituency)
